$AAPL   Thanks Brandon

@retailInvester9999 Speaking of the future vision, owning these media assets situates the company perfectly to more deeply benefit from all things remote, like gaming, VR, and education (think Science Channel, The Dodo, HGTV, Food Network etc).   
 
In order to hit big multiples, you have to see things before they happen and take the risk. I was 1-2 years ahead on $TSLA in 2018 and $TWTR in 2020, a few ahead on $AAPL in 2013. I took huge positions relative to my portfolio size and they made my portfolio today. What I see here is a hidden gem that’s just been discovered (pun..). A legacy that is a century old that’s finally found its proper place with this new management team and foundational infrastructure. It’s a company that could be around in another 100 years, and those are the ones that unlock real value. They’ve grown through acquisitions to date, but DTC will provide future growth. Media shapes reality. Content is king and $WBD has the goods.

$MSFT $TSLA $SPY $AAPL  
 
Pre-COVID levels are the name of the game. Everyone enjoyed that nice little Fed boost for the past year and a half they forgot the most important rule.

@retailInvester9999 This is a solid analysis of the base business but it’s the downside case imo.  
 
But the upside here is tremendous. Management does not do a good job hyping that vision. The new company owns the  factory” as Zaslav said on the call. There are NO better media assets under one roof in the market when looking at the whole package as far as margins, reach, diversification, depth, and quality. They are sitting on a goldmine while also owning the golden geese. With a consolidated product, in the near term it will become the go-to gold standard of streaming  (which is a profitable scalable business, hence why $AAPL and $AMZN got in. $AAPL project ROI is insane. They don’t waste money. All that said, $AAPL will never be able to replicate Warner/HBO production magic or Discovery’s savviness, industry relationships, and unscripted offerings. And $AMZN bought MGM but $WBD still owns all MGM assets pre 1986).
